autodse.explorer.gradient¶

The gradient-based search algorithm

class autodse.explorer.gradient.ExploreTreeNode¶

A named tuple node in the exploration tree.

point_key¶

The string key of the point in this node.

quality¶

The quality of the point in this node.

perf¶

The performance of this point in this node.

result¶

The result object of the point in this node.

child¶

A stack of point batches to be tuned.

tuned¶

A set of tuned parameter IDs.

child

Alias for field number 4

perf

Alias for field number 2

point_key

Alias for field number 0

quality

Alias for field number 1

result

Alias for field number 3

tuned

Alias for field number 5

class autodse.explorer.gradient.GradientAlgorithm(ds: Dict[str, autodse.parameter.DesignParameter], latency_thd: float = 64, fg_first: bool = True, quality_type: str = 'resource-efficiency', log_file_name: str = 'algo.log')¶

Explore the design space according to gradient.

We leverage hotspot analysis to locate a small set of high impact parameters and prior to them in order to deliver high QoR results at the early stage of exploration.

latency_thd¶

A threshold of the latency we want to improve. Loops with a smaller latency will not be optimized during the gradient process.

Type

int

fg_first¶

Indicate the order of optimizing a loop. True if we want to optimize inner-loops first, and vice versa.

Type

bool

quality_type¶

The quality type user wants to quantify design points. It is either 'resource-efficiency' (Performance / Resource), 'performance' (Performance), or 'finite-difference' (Delta Performance / Delta Resource).

Type

str

comp_order¶

An order of design parameter type the gradient algorithm should adopt when the lop is computation bound.

Type

List[str]

comm_order¶

An order of design parameter type the gradient algorithm should adopt when the lop is memory bound.

Type

List[str]

scope2param¶

A dictionary to map each kernel scope (e.g., loops, functions, etc) to a list of design parameters that can affect the scope.

Type

Dict[str, List[DesignParameter]]

compute_quality(curr_result: autodse.result.Result, new_result: autodse.result.Result) → float¶

Compute the quality of the point by referring the base one. Larger the better.

Parameters

  • curr_result -- The reference result.

  • new_result -- The new result to be qualified.

Returns

The quality value. Larger the better.

eff_as_quality(new_result: autodse.result.Result, ref_result: autodse.result.Result) → float¶

Compute the quality of the point by resource efficiency.

Parameters

  • new_result -- The new result to be qualified.

  • ref_result -- The reference result.

Returns

The quality value (negative finite differnece). Larger the better.

finte_diff_as_quality(new_result: autodse.result.Result, ref_result: autodse.result.Result) → float¶

Compute the quality of the point by finite difference method.

Parameters

  • new_result -- The new result to be qualified.

  • ref_result -- The reference result.

Returns

The quality value (negative finite differnece). Larger the better.

gen() → Generator[[List[Dict[str, Union[str, int]]], Optional[Dict[str, autodse.result.Result]]], None]¶

The main generator function of search algorithm.

Returns

A generator that keeps producing design points for exploration.

gen_child_points(root_point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]], focus: List[autodse.parameter.DesignParameter]) → List[autodse.explorer.gradient.ParamWPointBatch]¶

Generate points by manipulating the given parameters and sort them based on the order.

We evaluate the option expression in parameters to get a complete option list and cluster them to batches. The order of batches is determined by the "order" attribute in design space. In other words, the concept of batches is same as partitions.

Parameters

  • root_point -- The current design point we manipulated from.

  • focus -- A list of focus parameters to be manipulated.

Returns

A list of parameter-based design point batches.

gen_flatten_points(root_point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]]) → Optional[autodse.explorer.gradient.ParamWPointBatch]¶

Generate a batch of points that manipulate pipeline flatten positions.

This is an ad-hoc for the default config since the the benefit of exploring pipeline flatten position is obvious and it is worthwhile to try them first.

Parameters

root_point -- The current design point we manipulated from.

Returns

A point batch with each flatten point, or None if no such points.

get_hotspot_params(result: autodse.result.Result, tuned: Set[str]) → List[autodse.parameter.DesignParameter]¶

Identify the hotspot and tunable parameters using ordered_hotspot in result.

With the ordered performance bottleneck list that was analyzed by Merlin analyzer, we create the ordered hotspot parameter list to determine the search order.

Parameters

  • result -- The result generated by the analyzer.

  • tuned -- A set of parameter IDs that have been tuned.

Returns

A list of parameters that have impacts to the hotspot.

log_node(node: autodse.explorer.gradient.ExploreTreeNode) → None¶

Log information of an explore tree node

Parameters

node -- The target explore tree node.

log_result(tag: str, quality: float, result: autodse.result.Result) → None¶

Log information of the given result

Parameters

  • tag -- The tag of the corresponding design point.

  • quality -- The quantified result quality.

  • result -- The result to be logged.

perf_as_quality(new_result: autodse.result.Result) → float¶

Compute the quality of the point by (1 / latency).

Parameters

new_result -- The new result to be qualified.

Returns

The quality value. Larger the better.

class autodse.explorer.gradient.ParamWPointBatch¶

The named tuple for a parameter and batches of design points that manipulate the parameter.

param¶

The manipulated parameter. It can also be none if we only want to store a batch of points.

batches¶

A list of batches for design points by manipulating the parameter. Element in each batch is a tuple of design point key and content.

batches

Alias for field number 1

param

Alias for field number 0

autodse.explorer.gradient.gen_point_tag(point: Dict[str, Union[str, int]], param: autodse.parameter.DesignParameter) → str¶

Generate a tag for the given design point with 'pid-value' as its format.

Parameters

  • point -- The design point to be tagged.

  • param -- The parameter we interested in.

Returns

The tag of the point.

Return type

str

autodse.explorer.gradient.get_batch_name(batches: autodse.explorer.gradient.ParamWPointBatch) → str¶

Get the name of given batch set.

It is either the name of the represented parameter or "builtin" if no parameter is specified.

Parameters

batches -- The parameter with point batches.

Returns

The name of batches.
